CVE-2015-0202.title: Subversion, Serf: Multiple Vulnerabilities — GLSA 201610-05
CVE-2015-0202.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Subversion and Serf, the worst of which could lead to execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2015-0202.background: Subversion is a version control system intended to eventually replace CVS. Like CVS, it has an optional client-server architecture (where the server can be an Apache server running mod_svn, or an ssh program as in CVS’s :ext: method). In addition to supporting the features found in CVS, Subversion also provides support for moving and copying files and directories.
CVE-2015-0202.body: The serf library is a high performance C-based HTTP client library built upon the Apache Portable Runtime (APR) library.
CVE-2015-0202.extra: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Subversion and Serf. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details

CVE-2015-0204.title: OpenSSL: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201503-11
CVE-2015-0204.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in OpenSSL that can result in either Denial of Service or information disclosure.
CVE-2015-0204.background: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.
CVE-2015-0204.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in OpenSSL. Please review the CVE identifiers and the upstream advisory referenced below for details:

CVE-2015-0235.title: GNU C Library: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201503-04
CVE-2015-0235.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in GNU C Library, the worst of which allowing a local attacker to execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service .
CVE-2015-0235.background: The GNU C library is the standard C library used by Gentoo Linux systems.
CVE-2015-0235.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the GNU C Library. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-0235.extra: A local attacker may be able to execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service condition,.

CVE-2015-0247.title: e2fsprogs: Heap-based buffer overflow — GLSA 201701-06
CVE-2015-0247.subTitle: A heap-based buffer overflow in e2fsprogs might allow local attackers to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2015-0247.background: e2fsprogs is a set of utilities for maintaining the ext2, ext3 and ext4 file systems.
CVE-2015-0247.body: A heap-based buffer overflow was discovered in openfs.c in the libext2fs library in e2fsprogs.
CVE-2015-0247.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to use ext2fs library (for example, fsck) on a specially crafted Ext2/3/4 file system possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2015-0255.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in X.Org X Server. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

CVE-2015-0261.title: tcpdump: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201510-04

CVE-2015-0261.background: tcpdump is a Tool for network monitoring and data acquisition.
CVE-2015-0261.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in tcpdump. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-0261.extra: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, or cause a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2015-0278.title: libuv: Privilege escalation — GLSA 201611-10
CVE-2015-0278.subTitle: A vulnerability in libuv could lead to privilege escalation.
CVE-2015-0278.background: libuv is a multi-platform support library with a focus on asynchronous I/O.
CVE-2015-0278.body: It was discovered that libuv does not call setgroups before calling setuid/setgid. If this is not called, then even though the uid has been dropped, there may still be groups associated that permit superuser privileges.
CVE-2015-0278.extra: Context-dependent attackers could escalate privileges via unspecified vectors.

CVE-2015-0301.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Adobe Flash Player, the worst of which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2015-0301.background: The Adobe Flash Player is a renderer for the SWF file format, which is commonly used to provide interactive websites.
CVE-2015-0301.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Adobe Flash Player. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

CVE-2015-0818.title: Mozilla Products: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201504-01
CVE-2015-0818.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Mozilla Firefox, Thunderbird, and SeaMonkey, the worst of which may allow user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2015-0818.background: Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser and Mozilla Thunderbird an open-source email client, both from the Mozilla Project. The SeaMonkey project is a community effort to deliver production-quality releases of code derived from the application formerly known as the ‘Mozilla Application Suite’.
CVE-2015-0818.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Firefox, Thunderbird, and SeaMonkey. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-0818.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to view a specially crafted web page or email, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service condition. Furthermore, a remote attacker may be able to perform Man-in-the-Middle attacks, obtain sensitive information, spoof the address bar, conduct clickjacking attacks, bypass security restrictions and protection mechanisms, or have other unspecified impact.

The SeaMonkey project is a community effort to deliver production-quality releases of code derived from the application formerly known as the ‘Mozilla Application Suite’.
CVE-2015-0827.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Firefox, Thunderbird, and SeaMonkey. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-0827.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to view a specially crafted web page or email, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service condition. Furthermore, a remote attacker may be able to perform Man-in-the-Middle attacks, obtain sensitive information, spoof the address bar, conduct clickjacking attacks, bypass security restrictions and protection mechanisms, or have other unspecified impact.

CVE-2015-0860.title: dpkg: Arbitrary code execution — GLSA 201612-07
CVE-2015-0860.subTitle: A vulnerability was discovered in dpkg which could potentially lead to arbitrary code execution.
CVE-2015-0860.body: Gentoo Linux developer, Hanno Böck, discovered an off-by-one error in the dpkg-deb component of dpkg, the Debian package management system, which triggers a stack-based buffer overflow.
CVE-2015-0860.extra: An attacker could potentially execute arbitrary code if an user or an automated system were tricked into processing a specially crafted Debian binary package (.deb).

CVE-2015-3082.background: The Adobe Flash Player is a renderer for the SWF file format, which is commonly used to provide interactive websites.
CVE-2015-3082.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Adobe Flash Player. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-3082.extra: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, cause a Denial of Service condition, obtain sensitive information, or bypass security restrictions.

CVE-2015-3164.title: X.Org X Server: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201701-64
CVE-2015-3164.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in X.Org X Server, the worst of which may allow authenticated attackers to read from or send information to arbitrary X11 clients.
CVE-2015-3164.background: The X Window System is a graphical windowing system based on a client/server model.
CVE-2015-3164.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in X.Org X Server. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-3164.extra: An authenticated attacker could possibly cause a Denial of Service condition or read from or send information to arbitrary X11 clients.

CVE-2015-3182.title: Wireshark: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201510-03
CVE-2015-3182.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Wireshark, allowing attackers to cause Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2015-3182.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Wireshark. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-3182.extra: A remote attacker could possibly cause a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2015-3183.title: Apache: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201610-02
CVE-2015-3183.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Apache, the worst of which could allow HTTP request smuggling attacks or a Denial of Service condition.
CVE-2015-3183.background: Apache HTTP Server is one of the most popular web servers on the Internet.
CVE-2015-3183.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Apache HTTP Server. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-3183.extra: Remote attackers could bypass intended access restrictions, conduct HTTP request smuggling attacks, or cause a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2015-3184.title: Subversion, Serf: Multiple Vulnerabilities — GLSA 201610-05
CVE-2015-3184.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Subversion and Serf, the worst of which could lead to execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2015-3184.background: Subversion is a version control system intended to eventually replace CVS. Like CVS, it has an optional client-server architecture (where the server can be an Apache server running mod_svn, or an ssh program as in CVS’s :ext: method). In addition to supporting the features found in CVS, Subversion also provides support for moving and copying files and directories.
CVE-2015-3184.body: The serf library is a high performance C-based HTTP client library built upon the Apache Portable Runtime (APR) library.
CVE-2015-3184.extra: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Subversion and Serf. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details

CVE-2015-3187.title: Subversion, Serf: Multiple Vulnerabilities — GLSA 201610-05
CVE-2015-3187.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Subversion and Serf, the worst of which could lead to execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2015-3187.background: Subversion is a version control system intended to eventually replace CVS. Like CVS, it has an optional client-server architecture (where the server can be an Apache server running mod_svn, or an ssh program as in CVS’s :ext: method). In addition to supporting the features found in CVS, Subversion also provides support for moving and copying files and directories.
CVE-2015-3187.body: The serf library is a high performance C-based HTTP client library built upon the Apache Portable Runtime (APR) library.
CVE-2015-3187.extra: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Subversion and Serf. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details

CVE-2015-3197.title: OpenSSL: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201601-05
CVE-2015-3197.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in OpenSSL, allowing remote attackers to disclose sensitive information and complete weak handshakes.
CVE-2015-3197.background: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.
CVE-2015-3197.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenSSL. Please review the upstream advisory and CVE identifiers referenced below for details. Note that the list includes CVE identifiers for an older OpenSSL Security Advisory (3 Dec 2015) for which we have not issued a GLSA before.
CVE-2015-3197.extra: A remote attacker could disclose a server’s private DH exponent, or complete SSLv2 handshakes using ciphers that have been disabled on the server.

CVE-2015-3202.title: FUSE: incorrect filtering of environment variables leading to privilege escalation — GLSA 201603-04
CVE-2015-3202.subTitle: The fusermount binary in FUSE does not properly clear the environment before invoking mount or umount as root that allows a local user to overwrite arbitrary files.
CVE-2015-3202.background: FUSE provides an interface for filesystems implemented in userspace.
CVE-2015-3202.body: The fusermount binary calls setuid(geteuid()) to reset the RUID when it invokes /bin/mount so that it can use privileged mount options that are normally restricted if RUID != EUID. FUSE does not properly clear environment variables before invoking mount or umount as root allowing this to be passed to operations using elevated privileges such as LIBMOUNT_MTAB that is used by the mount commands debugging feature.
CVE-2015-3202.extra: The FUSE vulnerability allows a local, unprivileged user to overwrite arbitrary files on the system.

CVE-2015-3202.title: NTFS-3G: Privilege escalation — GLSA 201701-19
CVE-2015-3202.subTitle: A vulnerability in NTFS-3G allows local users to gain root privileges.
CVE-2015-3202.background: NTFS-3G is a stable, full-featured, read-write NTFS driver for various operating systems.
CVE-2015-3202.body: NTFS-3G is affected by the same vulnerability as reported in “GLSA 201603-04” when the bundled fuse-lite implementation is used.
CVE-2015-3202.extra: A local user could gain root privileges.

CVE-2015-3204.title: Libreswan: Multiple Vulnerabilities — GLSA 201603-13
CVE-2015-3204.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in libreSwan possibly resulting in Denial of Service.
CVE-2015-3204.background: Libreswan is a free software implementation of the most widely supported and standarized VPN protocol based on (“IPsec”) and the Internet Key Exchange (“IKE”).
CVE-2015-3204.body: The pluto IKE daemon in Libreswan, when built with NSS, allows remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service (assertion failure and daemon restart) via a zero DH g^x value in a KE payload in a IKE packet. Additionally, remote attackers could cause a Denial of Service (daemon restart) via an IKEv1 packet with (1) unassigned bits set in the IPSEC DOI value or (2) the next payload value set to ISAKMP_NEXT_SAK.
CVE-2015-3204.extra: Remote attackers could possibly cause Denial of Service.

CVE-2015-3209.title: QEMU: Arbitrary code execution — GLSA 201510-02
CVE-2015-3209.subTitle: A heap-based buffer overflow in QEMU could result in execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2015-3209.background: QEMU is a generic and open source machine emulator and virtualizer.
CVE-2015-3209.body: Heap-based buffer overflow has been found in QEMU’s PCNET controller.
CVE-2015-3209.extra: A remote attacker could execute arbitrary code via a specially crafted packets.

CVE-2015-3209.title: Xen: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201604-03
CVE-2015-3209.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Xen, the worst of which cause a Denial of Service.
CVE-2015-3209.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Xen. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-3209.extra: A local attacker could possibly cause a Denial of Service condition or obtain sensitive information.

CVE-2015-3214.title: QEMU: Arbitrary code execution — GLSA 201510-02
CVE-2015-3214.subTitle: A heap-based buffer overflow in QEMU could result in execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2015-3214.background: QEMU is a generic and open source machine emulator and virtualizer.
CVE-2015-3214.body: Heap-based buffer overflow has been found in QEMU’s PCNET controller.
CVE-2015-3214.extra: A remote attacker could execute arbitrary code via a specially crafted packets.

CVE-2015-3223.title: Samba: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201612-47
CVE-2015-3223.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Samba, the worst of which may allow execution of arbitrary code with root privileges.
CVE-2015-3223.background: Samba is a suite of SMB and CIFS client/server programs.
CVE-2015-3223.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in samba. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-3223.extra: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with root privileges, cause a Denial of Service condition, conduct a man-in-the-middle attack, obtain sensitive information, or bypass file permissions.

CVE-2015-3228.title: GPL Ghostscript: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 201612-33
CVE-2015-3228.subTitle: An integer overflow in GPL Ghostscript may allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2015-3228.background: Ghostscript is an interpreter for the PostScript language and for PDF.
CVE-2015-3228.body: An integer overflow flaw was discovered that leads to an out-of-bounds read and write in gs_ttf.ps.
CVE-2015-3228.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted file, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2015-3236.title: cURL: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201509-02
CVE-2015-3236.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in cURL, the worst of which can allow remote attackers to cause Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2015-3238.extra: Remote attackers could cause Denial of Service, conduct brute force attacks, and conduct username enumeration.

CVE-2015-3240.title: Libreswan: Multiple Vulnerabilities — GLSA 201603-13
CVE-2015-3240.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in libreSwan possibly resulting in Denial of Service.
CVE-2015-3240.background: Libreswan is a free software implementation of the most widely supported and standarized VPN protocol based on (“IPsec”) and the Internet Key Exchange (“IKE”).
CVE-2015-3240.body: The pluto IKE daemon in Libreswan, when built with NSS, allows remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service (assertion failure and daemon restart) via a zero DH g^x value in a KE payload in a IKE packet. Additionally, remote attackers could cause a Denial of Service (daemon restart) via an IKEv1 packet with (1) unassigned bits set in the IPSEC DOI value or (2) the next payload value set to ISAKMP_NEXT_SAK.
CVE-2015-3240.extra: Remote attackers could possibly cause Denial of Service.

CVE-2015-3255.body: A vulnerability was discovered in polkit’s polkit_backend_action_pool_init function due to duplicate action IDs in action descriptions.
CVE-2015-3255.extra: Local attackers are able to gain unauthorized privileges on the system.

CVE-2015-4432.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Adobe Flash Player. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-4432.extra: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, cause a Denial of Service condition, obtain sensitive information, or bypass security restrictions.

CVE-2015-4473.title: Mozilla Products: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201605-06
CVE-2015-4473.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Firefox, Thunderbird, Network Security Services (NSS), and NetScape Portable Runtime (NSPR) with the worst of which may allow remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2015-4473.background: Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser, Mozilla Thunderbird an open-source email client, and the Network Security Service (NSS) is a library implementing security features like SSL v.2/v.3, TLS, PKCS #5, PKCS #7, PKCS #11, PKCS #12, S/MIME and X.509 certificates. The SeaMonkey project is a community effort to deliver production-quality releases of code derived from the application formerly known as ‘Mozilla Application Suite’.
CVE-2015-4473.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Firefox, NSS, NSPR, and Thunderbird. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-4473.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to view a specially crafted web page or email, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service condition. Furthermore, a remote attacker may be able to perform Man-in-the-Middle attacks, obtain sensitive information, spoof the address bar, conduct clickjacking attacks, bypass security restrictions and protection mechanisms, or have other unspecified impacts.

CVE-2015-4551.title: LibreOffice, OpenOffice: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201603-05
CVE-2015-4551.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in both LibreOffice and OpenOffice allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause Denial of Service.
CVE-2015-4551.background: Apache OpenOffice is the leading open-source office software suite for word processing, spreadsheets, presentations, graphics, databases and more.
CVE-2015-4551.body: LibreOffice is a powerful office suite; its clean interface and powerful tools let you unleash your creativity and grow your productivity.
CVE-2015-4551.extra: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in both LibreOffice and OpenOffice that allow the remote execution of arbitrary code and potential Denial of Service. These vulnerabilities may be exploited through multiple vectors including crafted documents, link handling, printer setup in ODF document types, DOC file formats, and Calc spreadsheets. Please review the referenced CVE’s for specific information regarding each.

CVE-2015-4645.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in SQUASHFS, the worst of which may allow execution of arbitrary code
CVE-2015-4645.background: Squashfs is a compressed read-only filesystem for Linux. Squashfs is intended for general read-only filesystem use, for archival use (i.e. in cases where a .tar.gz file may be used), and in constrained block device/memory systems (e.g. embedded systems) where low overhead is needed.
CVE-2015-4645.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in SQUASHFS. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-4645.extra: Remote attackers, by enticing a user to process a specially crafted SQUASHFS image, could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process.

CVE-2015-4646.extra: Remote attackers, by enticing a user to process a specially crafted SQUASHFS image, could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process.

CVE-2015-5212.title: LibreOffice, OpenOffice: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201603-05
CVE-2015-5212.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in both LibreOffice and OpenOffice allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause Denial of Service.
CVE-2015-5212.background: Apache OpenOffice is the leading open-source office software suite for word processing, spreadsheets, presentations, graphics, databases and more.
CVE-2015-5212.body: LibreOffice is a powerful office suite; its clean interface and powerful tools let you unleash your creativity and grow your productivity.
CVE-2015-5212.extra: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in both LibreOffice and OpenOffice that allow the remote execution of arbitrary code and potential Denial of Service. These vulnerabilities may be exploited through multiple vectors including crafted documents, link handling, printer setup in ODF document types, DOC file formats, and Calc spreadsheets. Please review the referenced CVE’s for specific information regarding each.

CVE-2015-5313.title: libvirt: Directory traversal — GLSA 201612-10
CVE-2015-5313.subTitle: Libvirt is vulnerable to directory traversal when using Access Control Lists (ACL).
CVE-2015-5313.background: libvirt is a C toolkit for manipulating virtual machines.
CVE-2015-5313.body: Normally, only privileged users can coerce libvirt into creating or opening existing files using the virStorageVol APIs; and such users already have full privilege to create any domain XML.
CVE-2015-5313.extra: But in the case of fine-grained ACLs, it is feasible that a user can be granted storage_vol:create but not domain:write, and it violates assumptions if such a user can abuse libvirt to access files outside of the storage pool.

CVE-2015-5602.title: sudo: Unauthorized privilege escalation in sudoedit — GLSA 201606-13
CVE-2015-5602.subTitle: sudo is vulnerable to an escalation of privileges via a symlink attack.
CVE-2015-5602.background: sudo (su “do”) allows a system administrator to delegate authority to give certain users (or groups of users) the ability to run some (or all) commands as root or another user while providing an audit trail of the commands and their arguments.
CVE-2015-5602.body: sudoedit in sudo is vulnerable to the escalation of privileges by local users via a symlink attack. This can be exploited by a file whose full path is defined using multiple wildcards in “/etc/sudoers”, as demonstrated by “/home/*/*/file.txt”.
CVE-2015-5602.extra: Local users are able to gain unauthorized privileges on the system.

CVE-2015-5722.title: BIND: Denial of service — GLSA 201510-01
CVE-2015-5722.subTitle: A vulnerability in BIND could lead to a Denial of Service condition.
CVE-2015-5722.background: BIND (Berkeley Internet Name Domain) is a Name Server.
CVE-2015-5722.body: A vulnerability has been discovered in BIND’s named utility leading to a Denial of Service condition.
CVE-2015-5722.extra: A remote attacker may be able to cause Denial of Service condition via specially constructed zone data.

CVE-2015-6764.background: Chromium is an open-source browser project that aims to build a safer, faster, and more stable way for all users to experience the web.
CVE-2015-6764.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the Chromium web browser. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-6764.extra: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, cause a Denial of Service condition, obtain sensitive information, or bypass security restrictions.

CVE-2015-6817.title: PgBouncer: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201701-24
CVE-2015-6817.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in PgBouncer, the worst of which may allow an attacker to bypass authentication.
CVE-2015-6817.background: PgBouncer is a lightweight connection pooler for PostgreSQL.
CVE-2015-6817.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in PgBouncer. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-6817.extra: A remote attacker might send a specially crafted package possibly resulting in a Denial of Service condition. Furthermore, a remote attacker might bypass authentication in configurations using the “auth_user” feature.

CVE-2015-6833.extra: An attacker can possibly execute arbitrary code or create a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2015-6972.title: Openfire: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201612-50
CVE-2015-6972.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Openfire, the worst of which could lead to privilege escalation.
CVE-2015-6972.background: Openfire (formerly Wildfire) is a cross-platform real-time collaboration server based on the XMPP (Jabber) protocol.
CVE-2015-6972.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Openfire. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-6972.extra: A remote attacker could bypass the CSRF protection mechanism, conduct Cross-Site Scripting attacks, or an authenticated remote attacker could gain privileges while accessing Openfire’s web interface.

CVE-2015-7181.title: Mozilla Products: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201605-06
CVE-2015-7181.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Firefox, Thunderbird, Network Security Services (NSS), and NetScape Portable Runtime (NSPR) with the worst of which may allow remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2015-7181.background: Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser, Mozilla Thunderbird an open-source email client, and the Network Security Service (NSS) is a library implementing security features like SSL v.2/v.3, TLS, PKCS #5, PKCS #7, PKCS #11, PKCS #12, S/MIME and X.509 certificates. The SeaMonkey project is a community effort to deliver production-quality releases of code derived from the application formerly known as ‘Mozilla Application Suite’.
CVE-2015-7181.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Firefox, NSS, NSPR, and Thunderbird. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-7181.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to view a specially crafted web page or email, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service condition. Furthermore, a remote attacker may be able to perform Man-in-the-Middle attacks, obtain sensitive information, spoof the address bar, conduct clickjacking attacks, bypass security restrictions and protection mechanisms, or have other unspecified impacts.

CVE-2015-7181.title: Mozilla Products: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201512-10
CVE-2015-7181.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Mozilla Firefox and Thunderbird, the worst of which may allow user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2015-7181.background: Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser and Mozilla Thunderbird an open-source email client, both from the Mozilla Project.
CVE-2015-7181.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Mozilla Firefox and Mozilla Thunderbird. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-7181.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to view a specially crafted web page or email, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2015-7545.title: Git: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201605-01
CVE-2015-7545.subTitle: Git contains multiple vulnerabilities that allow for the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2015-7545.background: Git is a free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.
CVE-2015-7545.body: Git is vulnerable to the remote execution of arbitrary code by cloning repositories with large filenames or a large number of nested trees. Additionally, some protocols within Git, such as git-remote-ext, can execute arbitrary code found within URLs. These URLs that submodules use may come from arbitrary sources (e.g., .gitmodules files in a remote repository), and can effect those who enable recursive fetch. Restrict the allowed protocols to well known and safe ones.
CVE-2015-7545.extra: Remote attackers could execute arbitrary code on both client and server.

CVE-2015-8105.title: Roundcube: Multiple Vulnerabilities — GLSA 201603-03
CVE-2015-8105.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Roundcube allowing remote authenticated users to execute arbitrary code, inject arbitrary web scripts, and perform cross-site scripting (XSS).
CVE-2015-8105.background: Free and open source webmail software for the masses, written in PHP.
CVE-2015-8105.body: Remote authenticated users with certain permissions can read arbitrary files or possibly execute arbitrary code via .. in the _skin parameter to index.php. Additionally, a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in program/js/app.js allows remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the file name in a drag-n-drop file upload.
CVE-2015-8105.extra: A remote authenticated user could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, inject arbitrary web scripts or HTML, read arbitrary files, or perform XSS.

CVE-2015-8370.title: GRUB: Authentication bypass — GLSA 201512-03

CVE-2015-8370.body: An integer underflow in GRUB’s username/password authentication code has been discovered.

CVE-2015-8416.background: The Adobe Flash Player is a renderer for the SWF file format, which is commonly used to provide interactive websites.
CVE-2015-8416.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Adobe Flash Player. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-8416.extra: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, cause a Denial of Service condition, obtain sensitive information, or bypass security restrictions.

CVE-2015-8665.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to process a specially crafted image file, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2015-8770.title: Roundcube: Multiple Vulnerabilities — GLSA 201603-03
CVE-2015-8770.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Roundcube allowing remote authenticated users to execute arbitrary code, inject arbitrary web scripts, and perform cross-site scripting (XSS).
CVE-2015-8770.background: Free and open source webmail software for the masses, written in PHP.
CVE-2015-8770.body: Remote authenticated users with certain permissions can read arbitrary files or possibly execute arbitrary code via .. in the _skin parameter to index.php. Additionally, a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in program/js/app.js allows remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the file name in a drag-n-drop file upload.
CVE-2015-8770.extra: A remote authenticated user could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, inject arbitrary web scripts or HTML, read arbitrary files, or perform XSS.

CVE-2015-8837.title: fuseiso: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 202007-20
CVE-2015-8837.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in fuseiso, the worst of which could result in the arbitrary execution of code.

CVE-2015-8837.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted ISO file using fuseiso, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2015-8853.extra: A remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, cause a Denial of Service condition, or escalate privileges.

CVE-2015-8863.title: jq: Buffer overflow — GLSA 201612-20
CVE-2015-8863.subTitle: A buffer overflow in jq might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2015-8863.background: jq is a lightweight and flexible command-line JSON processor.
CVE-2015-8863.body: An off-by-one error was discovered in the tokenadd function in jv_parse.c which triggers a heap-based buffer overflow.
CVE-2015-8863.extra: A remote attacker could trick a victim into processing a specially crafted JSON file, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process. Additionally, a remote attacker could cause a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2015-8865.title: file: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201701-42

CVE-2015-8865.background: file is a utility that guesses a file format by scanning binary data for patterns.
CVE-2015-8865.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in file. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-8865.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to process a specially crafted input file, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, a Denial of Service condition or have other unspecified impacts.

CVE-2015-8865.title: PHP: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201611-22

CVE-2015-8865.background: PHP is a widely-used general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited for Web development and can be embedded into HTML.
CVE-2015-8865.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in PHP. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-8865.extra: An attacker can possibly execute arbitrary code or create a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2015-8868.title: Poppler: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201611-15
CVE-2015-8868.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Poppler, the worst of which allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2015-8868.background: Poppler is a PDF rendering library based on the xpdf-3.0 code base.
CVE-2015-8868.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Poppler. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-8868.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted PDF using Poppler, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2015-8869.title: OCaml: Buffer overflow and information disclosure — GLSA 201702-15
CVE-2015-8869.subTitle: A buffer overflow in OCaml might allow remote attackers to obtain sensitive information or crash an OCaml-based application.
CVE-2015-8869.background: OCaml is a high-level, strongly-typed, functional, and object-oriented programming language from the ML family of languages.
CVE-2015-8869.body: It was discovered that OCaml was vulnerable to a runtime bug that, on 64-bit platforms, causes size arguments to internal memmove calls to be sign-extended from 32- to 64-bits before being passed to the memmove function. This leads to arguments between 2GiB and 4GiB being interpreted as larger than they are (specifically, a bit below 2^64), causing a buffer overflow. Further, arguments between 4GiB and 6GiB are interpreted as 4GiB smaller than they should be causing a possible information leak.
CVE-2015-8869.extra: A remote attacker, able to interact with an OCaml-based application, could possibly obtain sensitive information or cause a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2015-8871.title: OpenJPEG: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201612-26
CVE-2015-8871.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in OpenJPEG, the worst of which may allow execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2015-8871.background: OpenJPEG is an open-source JPEG 2000 library.
CVE-2015-8871.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in OpenJPEG. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2015-8871.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted JPEG file, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service condition. Furthermore, a remote attacker may be able to obtain sensitive information.

CVE-2015-8921.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted archive file possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.
